about: Portfolio of Web Development Projects of Jonas Oppenlaender

past.title: NFDI4Culture – Consortium for research data on material and immaterial cultural heritage
past.description: Responsible for the design, implementation, population, and management of the NFDI4Culture knowledge graph as part of the NFDI4Culture project on research data infrastructures for material and immaterial cultural heritage. The project is funded by the German Research Foundation (Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft / DFG) #441958017

past.title: Folk Theories for a Better Understanding of Human-AI Interaction
past.description: Folk theories represent the users' beliefs of how an AI-driven system works. Prior research has investigated folk theories as a lens on users' reasoning about the algorithmically-curated content of news feeds on social media platforms, primarily in interview studies and surveys. In this project, we research and develop interactive interfaces for the structured capturing and crowdsourced collection of folk theories at scale. An understanding of how users reason about algorithmically-curated content could provide valuable insights into how web-based systems can be designed for fairness, accountability, and transparency. These three constituents contribute towards increased awareness and understanding of AI decisions, and could be a step stone to support the formation of trusting social relationships with Artificial Intelligence. The project is funded by the Nokia Foundation, Finnish Foundation for Technology, Jenny and Antti Wihuri Foundation, Tauno Tönning Foundation, and the Riitta and Jorma J. Takanen Foundation.

past.title: Crowdsourced Situated Feedback for Creative Artifacts
past.description: Implementation of a tablet application and web application for eliciting feedback for artworks displayed on public displays.

past.description: The portfolio you are looking at. To learn React, I transitioned it from Backbone/Mustache.

past.title: DriveNow Visualisation
past.description: Under the working title "Who called the clean-up crew", I created a visualisation of DriveNow cars in Berlin. The data was scraped from DriveNow. The visualisation shows 1) the location of the cars at a certain time, 2) the car cleanliness states, 3) the movements of single cars during the recorded timeframe, and 4) the movements of cars during which a clean-up event occurred. A clean-up is defined as an improvement of car cleanliness from "POOR" or "REGULAR" to "VERY_CLEAN". Note that the prototype loads all scraped data (about 25 MB) into the browser. It will take some time to display and interact with the visualisation.

past.title: CKAN FTP Harvester

past.title: Skills Planner
past.description:
Skills Planner is an ambitious project with aim to alleviate the skills shortage in the UK's construction industry. The £1.3 million project is partly funded by Innovate UK. The open data platform will integrate and interpret linked data provided by project partners such as Crossrail, HS2, and Tideway. The project has potential to be replicated across other sectors and countries.
My task in this project is to self-responsibly develop and implement the backend infrastructure of Skills Planner. The data is stored in a CKAN instance, which influenced my choice of programming language (Python). I have developed a set of data management and conversion tools that interact with CKAN. The tools can for example be used to
  • download resources of a package
  • convert Excel (and other tabular data) into CSV
  • produce Linked Data from tabular input data
  • assert the RDF into a triple store (4store)
  • and publish files to CKAN.
The tools can also flexibly execute any shell-based commands.

imgs.title: Code-based Documentation for the SkillsPlanner Tools

past.title: CKAN Extensions
past.description:
Development of SkillsPlanner-specific extensions to CKAN (closed source). The extensions include:
  • A new tab on the package page to trigger the build and view the build logs,
  • additional form fields,
  • custom configuration options, and
  • authorization for the web page (disallowing not-logged in users to view CKAN content).

imgs.title: SkillsPlanner CKAN Extension: Custom build tab with build tools
SkillsPlanner CKAN Extension: Initiating the build from the web interface
SkillsPlanner CKAN UI Modifications: Build tab, filenames, quick upload button
SkillsPlanner CKAN UI Modifications: Build log

past.purpose: Supporting the SkillsPlanner Linked Data platform

past.title: LinkedIn Chrome Extension
past.description: A Google Chrome browser extension to save LinkedIn contacts locally, without having to connect to them. The extension works great - I use it personally. There are just a few details to iron out (e.g. cross-device syncing of saved contacts) before the extension can be released in the Chrome webstore.

past.title: CrowdUI - A Remote Tool to Crowdsource and Evaluate User Interface Adaptions
past.description: A prototype of a tool that can be added to any website to allow the users to re-arrange any parts of the website. The tool has an integrated user survey and mechanism to evaluate the usefulness of the adaptions. Interface adaptions are stored and loaded for evaluation by a control group of users.

imgs.title: Phase 2 - User interface adaption through the user
Phase 3 - Interface evaluation through the user
Phase 4 - Tool evaluation through the user

past.title: BuxomCMS
past.description:
Content Management System for adult entertainment websites, designed and implemented in 2011. Object-oriented MVC and built in PHP with Zend-Framework best practices. The CMS contained sophisticated video transcoding, automatic gallery thumbnail processing with progress information, thumbnail cropping and many more features.
Shortly before I finished this project, I learned about the availability of online transcoding services. Not wanting to waste more time and to base my solution on other services, I abandoned the project. If I had to implement such a CMS today, I would make heavy use of JavaScript, probably going for a single-page approach.

past.title: Open Data Visualisation
past.description: Visualisation of CSV data (US government IT projects) as part of the Open Data Innovation course module. The data was cleaned with Open Refine and Excel.
past.purpose: Coursework for module COMP6214 Open Data Innovation

past.title: Car Prices Visualization Prototype
past.description: Prototype visualizing car prices along three dimensions: registration year, mileage, and price.

past.title: PowerPoint-like presentation web application
past.description: A "computer artefact" that demonstrates some aspects of the traditional Software Engineering development model in an interactive way. The user can browse through the application like a PowerPoint presentation. The application also features several interactive riddles and quizzes. The user interface is responsive and was tested on different screen sizes.

imgs.title: One of the multiple choice quizzes

past.purpose: Coursework for module COMP6233 Topics in Computer Science

past.title: RESTful Webservice
past.description: An implementation of a Stackoverflow-like question-and-answer system. We made the decision to get things done quickly. Lots of duplicated code and poor maintainability was the price to pay for the quick win.
past.purpose: Coursework for module COMP6218 Web Architecture

past.title: Webcam chat system
past.description: Developed a webcam chat system for my online community website. The system made use of the Highwinds CDN video streaming capabilities. The chat was implemented with NodeJS. The VPN provider switched from Highwinds to Level3 soon afterwards and I subsequently lost access to the Highwinds API.

past.title: IT Portal Prototype

past.title: University Association Website Prototype
past.description: This was a prototype I created for the Sailing association of my university. The final product would have required some more work in Photoshop. It was decided not to go with a dynamic website, so the prototype was not finished.

past.title: IT Service Catalogue
past.description: I was in charge of updating and improving the IT service catalogue of a large engineering company (Alstom) through four release cycles. The IT service catalogue Excel file was later used as input in the transition towards an internally developed group-wide IT Service Web Portal. I was one of the few beta testers of this IT portal.

imgs.title: Alstom IT Service Catalog and IT Portal testing

past.purpose: IT Service Catalogue restructuring and maintenance and transitioning to IT portal

past.title: Excel and PowerPoint Automation
past.description: Part of my role as a trainee at Alstom was to create monthly status reports. I reworked and extended an existing solution to automate the reports using VBA. The resulting script was able to output both an Excel file with diagrams and a ready-to-go PowerPoint presentation to be sent to the managers in the product lines.
past.purpose: Automation of KPI reports for idea management system

past.title: Service Request Design and Testing
past.description: At Alstom, I designed and managed the implementation of IT services and IT service request forms. I was also responsible for the final acceptance testing of these service requests. I proactively improved the Service Request testing template.

imgs.title: Service request testing user interface testing
